register.description: Standard revision number, BCD encoded

bitfield.description: Major revision number
Minor revision number

register.description: Standard system configuration register

bitfield.description: Enable autogating of L3 interconnect-derived internal clocks while module is idle.

bitenum.description: L3 interconnect-derived internal clocks OFF during idle
L3 interconnect-derived internal clocks ON during idle

bitfield.description: Slave interface power management control. Idle Req/ack control

bitenum.description: Force-Idle mode. Sidleack asserted after Idlereq assertion
Smart-idle mode. Sidleack asserted after Idlereq assertion when no more activity on the USB.

bitfield.description: Asynchronous wakeup generation control (Swakeup)
Module software reset
Internal autogating control

bitenum.description: When no activity on L3 interconnect, clock is cut off.

register.description: Standard system status register

bitfield.description: Indicates when the module has entirely come out of reset

register.description: Standard IRQ status vector. Write 1 to clear a bit.

bitfield.description: Access error to ULPI register over L3 interconnect: USB clock must run for that type of access to succeed.

Functional clock is no longer requested for USB clockingWhen TLL_SHARED_CONF[1] FCLK_REQ=0 and TLL_SHARED_CONF[0] FCLK_IS_ON=1, IRQ is generated to request the clock to be switched OFF and FCLK_END is set to 1.

Functional clock is requested for USB clockingWhen TLL_SHARED_CONF[1] FCLK_REQ=1 and TLL_SHARED_CONF[0] FCLK_IS_ON=0, IRQ is generated to request the clock to be switched ON and FCLK_START is set to 1.

register.description: Standard IRQ enable vector

bitfield.description: Enable IRQ generation upon access error to ULPI register over L3 interconnect
IRQ event mask for FCLK_END interrupt (seeUSBTLL_IRQSTATUS[1])
IRQ event mask for FCLK_START interrupt (seeUSBTLL_IRQSTATUS[0])

register.description: Common control register for all TLL channels

bitfield.description: Software enable/disable of the 90-degree phase shift scheme on output DDR data, when implemented. Read-only, always-0 when HDL generic ULPI_90DEG4DDR = 0.

bitenum.description: ULPI DDR output DATA aligned with CLK
ULPI DDR output DATA delayed by 90 degree wrt CLK

bitfield.description: Software enable/disable of the 180-degree phase shift scheme on output SDR data, when implemented. Read-only, always-0 when HDL generic ULPI_180DEG4SDR = 0

bitenum.description: ULPI SDR output DATA aligned with CLK
ULPI SDR output DATA delayed by 180 degree wrt CLK

bitfield.description: (Log2 of) division ratio from functional clock to USB (UTMI/ULPI) clock
Functional clock request, ORed from all channels depending on their respective USB bus state.Combined with the Fclk_is_on status to generate fclk_start/end IRQs.

bitenum.description: Func clock input is not requested by TLL
Func clock input is requested by TLL

bitfield.description: Status of the functional clock input, provided by the system to the TLL module. The TLL module will only use that clock if the current status indicated that it is ready.Combined with the Fclk_request to generate fclk_start/end IRQs.

bitenum.description: Functional clock input is not guaranteed ON (can actually be ON, OFF, or unstable)
Functional clock input is guaranteed ON and stable

register.description: Control and Status register for channel I.

bitfield.description: Line state for Full/Low speed serial modesBit1 = D–/ Bit0 = D+
Multiple-mode serial interface's mode select. Only when main channel mode is serial. No effect in other main modes.

bitenum.description: '6pin' unidirectional PHY i/f mode. TX encoding is Dat/Se0 (default)
'6-pin' unidirectional PHY i/f mode. TX encoding is Dp/Dm
'6pin' unidirectional TLL mode. TX encoding is Dat/Se0
'6pin' unidirectional TLL mode. TX encoding is Dp/Dm
'2-pin' bidirectional TLL mode. Encoding is Dat/Se0
'2-pin' bidirectional TLL mode. Encoding is Dp/Dm

bitfield.description: Force-Se0 transmit override value for serial mode testDon't care if TestEn = 0 (functional mode) or = TestTxen = 1 (tx = hiz)

bitenum.description: Drive differential value on TX according to TestTXDat

bitfield.description: Differential data transmit override value for serial mode testDon't care if TestEn = 0 (functional mode) or = TestTxen = 1 (tx = hiz) or TestSe0 = 1 (tx = se0)
Differential data transmit override value for serial mode testDon't care if TestEn = 0 (functional mode)

bitenum.description: Drive TX Hiz (no drive: Pullups determine line state)

bitfield.description: Enable manual test override for serial mode TX path (from local controller's UTMI port)

bitenum.description: No override. TX is from local link controller

bitfield.description: VBUS-drive for ChanMode = serial* In TLL config, write 1 to emulate serial-side VBUS drive* In PHY config, write 1 to report 'VBUS valid' status (of actual VBUS) to UTMI controller
VBUS-drive for ChanMode = serial* In TLL config, write 1 to emulate serial-side VBUS charge/pullup (OTG)* In PHY config, write 1 to reports 'session valid' status (of actual VBUS) to UTMI controller

bitenum.description: VBUS not charged, session not valid

bitfield.description: Disable bitstuff emulation in ULPI TLL for ULPI ChanMode
For ChanMode = ULPI TLL only. Allow the ULPI output clock to be stopped when ULPI goes into asynchronous mode (low-power, 3-pin serial, 6-pin serial). No effect in ULPI input clock mode.

bitenum.description: ULPI output clock stops during asynchronous ULPI modes

bitfield.description: For ChanMode = ULPI TLL only. Allow the UTMI clock (output) to be stopped when UTMII goes to suspended mode (suspendm = 0)

bitenum.description: UTMI clock output gated upon suspend

bitfield.description: Select single/double data rate (SDR/DDR) mode for ULPI TLLReset value depends on hardware generics ULPI_SDR/DDR_MODE.
ULPI clocking mode select for ULPI TLL ChanMode

bitenum.description: ULPI clock provided by LINK (that is, off-chip). ULPI clock is input
ULPI clock provided by PHY side (that is, TLL, from functional clock). ULPI clock is output

bitfield.description: Sets PHY speed emulation in TLL (full/slow), which determines the line to pull up upon connect. The two connect source controls are: Input m(N)_tllpuen, register field TllConnect.
Emulation of Full/Low-Speed connect (that is, D+ resp D– pullup) for serial TLL modes. Speed is determined by field TllSpeed.
Emulates cable attach/detach for all serial TLL modes:* ChanMode = serial, in TLL mode (FsLsMode)* ChanMode = ULPI, in serial mode (6pin/3pin TLL)

bitenum.description: Cable detach emulated on serial TLL
Cable attach emulated on serial TLL

bitfield.description: Select the cable end 'seen' by UTMI side of TLL, that is, the emulated USB cable's orientation.Note that host must always be on A side, Peripheral on B side.Reset value depends on generic DEFUTMIISHOST.

bitenum.description: UTMI side is peripheral, ULPI side is host
UTMI side is host, ULPI side is peripheral

Charge VBUS through a resistor for VBUS-pulsing SRP.
Discharge VBUS through a resistor, until the session-end VBUS state is reached.
Enables the 15kΩ pull-down resistor on D–

bitenum.description: Pull-down resistor not connected to D–

bitfield.description: Enables the 15kΩ pull-down resistor on D+

bitenum.description: Pull-down resistor not connected to D+

bitfield.description: Pull-up to the (OTG) ID line to allow its sampling

register.description: Enables an interrupt event notification when the corresponding status bit changes from low to high. By default, all transitions are enabled. Read/Write address.

bitfield.description: Generate an interrupt event notification when IdGnd changes from low to high.Event is automatically masked if IdPullup bit is cleared to 0 and for 50 ms after IdPullup is set to 1.
Generate an interrupt event notification when SessEnd changes from low to high.
Generate an interrupt event notification when SessValid changes from low to high. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Generate an interrupt event notification when VbusValid changes from low to high.
Generate an interrupt event notification when Hostdisconnect changes from low to high. Applicable only in host mode (DpPulldown and DmPulldown both set to 1b).

register.description: Set by unmasked changes on the corresponding status bits to generate the ULPI interrupt. Cleared upon read, and when Low Power Mode, Serial Mode or Carkit Mode are entered.

bitfield.description: Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on IdGnd. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessEnd. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on SessValid. Cleared when this register is read. SessValid is the same as UTMI+ AValid.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on VbusValid. Cleared when this register is read.
Set to 1 by the PHY when an unmasked event occurs on Hostdisconnect. Cleared when this register is read. Applicable only in host mode.

register.description: Part of non-standard UTMI-to-ULPI mailbox system, implemented if HDL generic VCS_MAILBOX bit is 1 UTMI-standard Vcontrol vector byte is sent by the UTMI controller (other side of TLL) to its PHY (emulated here by the TLL). Alternatively, data can be also written directly into the register. Can contain any user-defined data. Vcontrol bit changes can be used to assert the ULPI ALT interrupt. Lowest VCS_CTRL_WIDTH (HDL generic) bits are implemented, others are always-0, read-only. (UTMI standard is 4-bit).

bitfield.description: User-defined UTMI Control data byte

(UTMI standard is 4-bit).
